title: Real Madrid vs Osasuna: How to watch online and on TV, prediction and more
text:
Real Madrid and Osasuna meet at Santiago Bernabéu Stadium tonight in a La Liga encounter.

Zinedine Zidane’s side come off the back of a well needed 1-0 victory at Seville last weekend, placing them at third in the table and level on points with leaders Granada and second-place Athletic Bilbao.

The Spanish side will be looking to gain three points tonight in order for them to gain a chance of going to the top of the standings.

We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. From 15p €0.18 $0.18 USD 0.27 a day, more exclusives, analysis and extras.

Osasuna will not make this easy for the side. Jagoba Arrasate’s side are yet to be beaten this season, even going as far as to draw with Barcelona.

At the two sides last meeting Real Madrid triumphed over Osasuna with a score of 3-1.

When is it?

Real Madrid vs Osasuna will kick off on the 25th September at 20:00 (BST)

How can I watch it?

Premier Sport 2 will be broadcasting the action. Premier Sports is available via channel 435 on Sky, and 552 on Virgin TV.

FuboTV will be streaming the match to laptops, smartphones and tablet’s

Team news

Real Madrid

Zinedine Zidane’s side has been plagued with injury with Marcelo, Ferland, Luka Modric and Isco all being on the path to recovery

Gareth Bale will be also forced to watch from the side-lines tonight. No statement has been released regarding injury so it is believed he is being allowed to rest before Saturday’s derby clash with Athletico Madrid.

Osasuna

Osasuna also have a number of players out with injury with most serious of those being Kike Barja who is not expected to be avalible until the latter stages of the season.

Unai Garcia, Inigo Perez and Darko Brasanac are also all injured but should be returning to the pitch soon.

Predicted line-up

Real Madrid

Courtois; Carvajal, Varane, Ramos, Mendy; Casemiro, Kroos, Bale, Rodriguez; Hazard; Benzema

Osasuna

Joel; Mandi, Pedraza, Bartra, Royal; Garcia, Fekir, Juanmi, Guardado; Iglesias, Canelas

Odds

After their 1-0 win over Sevilla, Betway are backing Real Madrid as favourites with odds of 2/13

If you feel that Osasuna will continue there string of draws then you can back that for 15/4

Prediction

Following a 1-0 victory at Sevilla last weekend, it is looking like Real Madrid will take the victory tonight despite their uncertain form. But the side may find it a tougher game than anticipated as Osasuna have drawn four of their opening five games, including a draw with Barcelona, and conceding just three goals.

Madrid will take the victory but they will have to fight for it.
